results.title: ‘David Byrne’s American Utopia’ Review: Opening a Wide, Wonderful World
results.abstract: Spike Lee joins forces with David Byrne for a joyous concert movie that rocks and delights, sending you high and then higher.

results.title: For 3 Filmmakers, Now Is the Best Time for a Coronavirus Documentary
results.abstract: The prolific documentarian Alex Gibney and his two co-directors hope to have an impact on the election with “Totally Under Control.”

results.title: Yes, There Will Be an Oscar Season. But What Will It Look Like?
results.abstract: There are few big-budget contenders and the ceremony may be reduced, but the list of nominees could be more diverse than ever.

results.title: Brandon Cronenberg Will Now Perform an Interview
results.abstract: The director of the provocative horror film “Possessor Uncut” argues that none of us are ever truly ourselves: “There’s an internal performance that we all engage with.”

multimedia.caption: Acting like a director: Brandon Cronenberg in Toronto. He said his film is rooted in “moments feeling disconnected from my life.”

results.title: A Famed Horror Director Mines Japan’s Real-Life Atrocities
results.abstract: Kiyoshi Kurosawa’s latest movie, which recently won him the award for best director at the Venice Film Festival, is a thriller animated by the ghosts of Japan’s ghastly wartime experiments.

results.title: Henry Golding Drew on His Own Cultural Confusion in ‘Monsoon’
results.abstract: The actor discussed how playing a British-Vietnamese man trying to understand his identity resonated with Golding’s experiences living in Britain and Malaysia.

results.title: Need an Essential Chronicler of America? Try This Nonfiction Master
results.abstract: Frederick Wiseman captures life unfolding within institutions. If that sounds boring, the riveting “Public Housing” shows why his work is anything but.
